Something to experience every step of the way. A great place to get lost in. Just wandering and finding something wonderful on every corner is essential for a great time in Rome

Rome to the extreme!. No way one can say is too crowded... Enjoy it! I enjoy walking into the throngs, just remember, watch your wallet, in all the senses, some will simply overcharge you, others will take it from you, and do not forget dinner at Trastevere.
History everywhere. Walking through the historical center is amazing! Everywhere we looked we could see very antique buildings.

We lived here a week.. We had a small apartment in this district, using the 40 express bus or the 64 bus to get us to Termini or to St. Peter's and the Vatican. We loved the narrow streets, the small shops and markets. The walk to the Roman excavations and the Colosseum were not that far, either.
Drift and dream. Just drift through the area and dream of times past. The evidence is everywhere. Many hidden squares and marvellous churches,statues, paintings await your gaze. Don't hurry-saunter.
This is what Rome is all about. If you can stay at a hotel in Rome's centro storico, then nearly everything you want to see and visit will be within walking distance
THE Monument of Rome. You can't leave Rome without seeing the Coliseum. Easy to reach with the subway stop COLOSSEO on the linea B. Great area to walk around. ENJOY!

All roads lead to Rome. You can travel the world over but eventually all roads lead to Rome, our own adaption to the classic proverb. Having traveled the world over, Rome is easily a top five favorite place for us and for very good reason. The historical importance of Rome, a easy UNESCO World Heritage sight choice, and it's role in shaping the development of western society, religion and civilization are beyond need to explain. And there is so much to do, see, taste and experience here that is meaningful, magnificent and memorable in nature, that it can be difficult to explain. It is a place that iconic structures, buildings, squares, fountains and scenes known the world over. It is a place that almost everybody recognizes and few can forget. Visiting Rome, in our view, is like walking back into our world's history, allowing us to experience, appreciate and hopefully learn something about why our modern world is shaped the way it presently is, why it operates the way it does and why we live our lives the way we do. Much of these answers stem from Roman and (Holy See) history which have so greatly contributed to how we view and interact in the world around us today. Philosophically speaking, all roads still lead back to Rome. The opportunity to spend time in the city center in Rome is simply special, something everyone can hopefully try to experience at least once in their lifetime. The attractions that you can see and experience here seem endless, many that shouldn't be missed even during the shortest of visits to Rome. Here are a few that should be included in all visitors 'must see' list of things to do while visiting the city centre. 1.) Vatican Museum 2.) St. Peter's Basilica3.) Colosseum, Roman and Imperial Forum4.) Pantheon 5.) Piazza Navona and the Trevi FountainIf you only have one day in Rome, you make sure that you see the list of attractions above. If you have more time, you can consider other outstanding, wondrous attractions within the city. Some are included below. 6.) San Giovanni in Laterano and Santa Scala7.) Basilica di San Clemente8.) Santa Maria Maggiore9.) Santa Passade10.) Santa Maria della Vittorio11.) Galleria Borghese and Villa Borghese12.) Museo National Romano13.) Museo Capitolini 14.) Piazza di Spagna (Spanish Steps)15.) Piazza del PopoloAnd there are many more very good spots to consider when visiting the city, these are just some of the most important, special and memorable that we've been fortunate enough to have experienced during trips to Rome over the years. This is a city that we will probably always go back to. Its just that good!
waking in a museum. just look around, it is all abselutely beautiful! We just love to stroll - and remember to take a look at the walls, the roof, the corners.....

Stay right here!. Central by name, central by nature. A flat, easy walk to all the major attractions in Rome, plus you can get a feeling for real life in the city. The lanes twist and turn, and there's always something unexpected.
just wander. No matter where you went there was something else fascinating to see.
Shopping. You catwalk from the hotel and go to center in 15 minutes. Nice shopping area.
the real taste of Rome. restaurants, shops, groceries, markets, palaces... colors, smells.... don't hesitate to get lost in the small streets! you can only find treasures!

Full of history. Municipality of Rome can't keep up with maintenance. I can understand why: Rome is big, and actually one huge monument. With all the tourists, local inhabitants, commuting workers the city is worn out and polluted... But oh so worth visiting.
Excellent for a walk. History everywere and you always can stop by for an ice cream in the neighborhood or a expresso.
Spectacular. Phenomenal historical site, that has been well preserved for over 2000 years
just get lost. lovely place to wander around. very safe at all times. smaller than paris.

like a movie set. If you are not run down by motorists, it is so picturesque -- just like a movie set! They really take pride in the beauty. Buildings that need scaffolding for work are covered with reproduction images of the building itself. Windows no longer in use are painted back in to match.

Staying in Rome. Stay in the Centro Storico. The central city of Rome is one of the nicest pedestrian friendly places in the world. The area is compact, the major sites are close to each other. The area is safe (except for pickpockets) can be walked at any hour of the day or night and always seems to be alive.Turn any corner and be surprised, look in any window and see something new, or old. Avoid restaurants with menus that are posted on the street with hawkers trying to drag you in. But the folks that do the work of hawking, when acknowledged, are polite and friendly. Some sights never seem to quiet down, the Trevi Fountain being one of them. All sights that take reservations should be reserved in advance. Walk, walk, walk. Eat, drink, watch. There is no other place like Rome.

splendid history. marvelous historical buildings and squares (such as piazza Navona, steps of piazza Espana, ...), although a lot of buildings need some renovation, Rome is not that clean, a lot of graffiti, garbage, ...)

Real Rome - hidden jewels. Discover for yourself the narrow streets and flower filled passages, the Campo de Fiori - a mass of Mimosa whilst we were there, the Pantheon, the beautiful Chiesa Di Sant'Ignazio Di Loyola and sample the best pasta, capuccino and gelato.

Rome. as one of the top tourist destinations in the world, Rome has a lot to offer. History, art and cuisine. The town is in deep need for an extended subway network, but the center is well connected. I would advice to take on the huge number of objectives in the summer as it can be very hot
Interesting and clean. Liked history and shopping were very big and nice in via del corso and the jewish ghetto was nice too

Do take the 116 bus. To speak of Centro Storico is as diverse a notion as 'Manhattan'. Everyone will find their niche. We stayed in via del Governo Vecchio, between Piazza Navona and the Ponte San Angelo for a month - eat your hearts out! ....In an apartment with bed, bath and kitchen, for Euros 1400 for 32 nights. Hunt for the good things at right price - away from top of season, before the Centro is invaded by the barbarians from the north!Walking out is a sheer joy. The eye adapts to natural pigment paint, with its faded and varied finish, and to the enormous diversity of architecture and life, from building to building, street to street. You may take an academic interest in this or that, you may just bathe with exuberance in the aesthetic experience.It is good to go to shop for food and to restaurants a little further away. A sound basic rule is 'not within one hundred metres of a tourist site' - which is of course hard anywhere in the 'Centro Storico'.Our device for getting through to the other end of the centro, when feet tired or time gone, was to find the 116 bus. It is one of several small electric buses specifically designed to run on narrow streets. Hopefully this link will give you the route map going from the Tiber end to the Villa Borghese:http://trovalinea.atac.roma.it/zoom_in.asp?VediSemafori=off&VediMeb=off&VediParcometri=off&VediFermate=off&VediLinee=off&VediRivendite=off&percorso=116R&idmtram=52173&xmax=2312274&ymax=4643811&xmin=2309287&ymin=4640755&tipologia=URB&linea=116&circo=NOand here is my handheld-behind-driver's-head movie of part of the trip.

Full of historic charm. We spent days taking in all of the sights here. It is breathtaking! If you appreciate having the opportunity to visit so many historic Roman sights within walking distance of each other then this is a must for you.

oh my god. what can i say? rome city center is the most wonderful thing that you can see in the whole world. you can spend days, weeks always wandering around there and you never get bored, for sure u'll always find new discoveries.
